page.title: 07VINE GROWING IN TANGLEY.
page.content: Mr.James Page-Roberts has lived in Tangley for six years and finds the soil and chalky sub soil very good for growing vines which is why he chose to live there.Although his vineyard is only thirteen paces by twenty five paces in a good year he grows sufficient grapes to produce three hundred bottles of white wine .In England the climate is very good for vines but only for white grapes as there is not enough sun to ripen the red grapes.It was generally thought that vines would not grow successfully at a height over 300 feet above sea level,but Mr. Page-Roberts has shown this to be false as he finds his Muller-Thurgau vines grow well at over 600 feet above sea level.
